content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-347-07-A
|Item_parent=Acute urine retention
|Item_parent_short=Acute urine retention
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the initial assessment of urinary retention
|Description=None
|Rubric=Additional tests
|Contributors=Jonathan Olivier
|Order=7}}

* No further tests are required as a matter of urgency.
* If there is any doubt about the diagnosis, a suprapubic ultrasound may be performed to assess bladder fullness.

question.question: What is the initial assessment of urinary retention in a patient with acute urine retention?
question.option_a: A suprapubic ultrasound is always performed to assess bladder fullness.
question.option_b: No further tests are required as a matter of urgency.
question.option_c: A urinalysis and urine culture are performed to rule out infection.
question.option_d: An ultrasound is performed to assess kidney function.
